Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class StringMethods

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.StringMethods
public final class StringMethods extends Object
Methods for working with strings. Many of them are geared towards printing strings. Instead of accepting a String argument, they will take an Object. The parameter name will then be "subject". If the object is null, these methods will usually return an empty string, else they will call toString() on the object and process the resulting String. In other words, these methods are null-safe with respect to the string to be processed, and they will never return null themselves. For ease of reading the subject parameter will still be referred to as a String.

    The empty string.

    substrAfter(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
    Returns everything after (not including) the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string there is no nth occurrence of the substring.
    static String
    substrBefore(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
    Returns everything up to (not including) the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string if there is no nth occurrence of the substring.
    static String
    substrFrom(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
    Returns everything from (inclusive) the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string if there is no nth occurrence of the substring.If the type of subject is String, you can do a reference comparison between input and output string to ascertain whether the substring was found.
    static String
    substrTo(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
    Returns everything up to, and including the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string if there is no nth occurrence of the substring.
    static String
    trim(Object subject, String chars)
    Left and right-trims the specified string.

      substr - The substring to search for (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:

      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for (must not be null or empty)
      ignoreCase - Whether to ignore case while comparing substrings
      Returns:

    • count

      public static int count(Object subject, String substr, boolean ignoreCase, int limit)
      Counts the number of occurrences of substr within subject. Returns 0 (zero) if subject is null.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for (must not be null or empty)
      ignoreCase - Whether to ignore case while comparing substrings
      limit - The maximum number of occurrences the count. You may specify 0 (zero) for "no maximum".
      Returns:
      The number of occurrences of substr within subject (will not exceed limit)

    • countDiscrete

      public static int countDiscrete(Object subject, String substr)
      Counts the number of non-overlapping occurrences of substr within subject. The string to search for must not be null or empty and is not treated as a regular expression. Returns 0 (zero) if subject is null.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      Returns:
      The number of non-overlapping occurrences of substr within subject

    • countDiscrete

      public static int countDiscrete(Object subject, String substr, boolean ignoreCase)
      Counts the number of non-overlapping occurrences of substr within subject. The string to search for must not be null or empty and is not treated as a regular expression. Returns 0 (zero) if subject is null.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      ignoreCase - Whether to ignore case while comparing substrings
      Returns:
      The number of non-overlapping occurrences of substr within subject

    • countDiscrete

      public static int countDiscrete(Object subject, String substr, boolean ignoreCase, int limit)
      Counts the number of non-overlapping occurrences of substr within subject. Returns 0 (zero) if subject is null.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      ignoreCase - Whether to ignore case while comparing substrings
      limit - The maximum number of occurrences the count. You may specify 0 (zero) for "no maximum".
      Returns:
      The number of non-overlapping occurrences of substr within subject (will not exceed limit)

    • ellipsis

      public static String ellipsis(Object subject, int maxWidth)
      Returns subject.toString() if its length does not exceed maxWidth, else truncates the string and appends "...", such that the new string's length does not exceed maxWidth.

      Examples:

       String hello = "Hello World, how are you?";
 assertEquals("Hello W...", ellipsis(hello, 10));
 assertEquals("H...", ellipsis(hello, 4));
 assertEquals(hello, ellipsis(hello, 100));
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to abbreviate, if necessary
      maxWidth - The maximum width of the string (must be greater than 3)
      Returns:
      The string itself or an abbreviated version, suffixed with "..."

    • endsWith

      public static String endsWith(Object subject, boolean ignoreCase, Collection<String> suffixes)
      Whether the specified string ends with any of the specified suffixes.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to test
      ignoreCase - Whether to ignore case
      suffixes - The suffixes to test
      Returns:
      The first suffix found to be equal to the end of the string, or null if the string ended in none of the specified suffixes

    • endsWith

      public static String endsWith(Object subject, boolean ignoreCase, String... suffixes)
      Whether subject ends with any of the specified suffixes. Returns the first suffix found to be equal to the end of the string, or null if the string ended in none of the specified suffixes.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to test
      ignoreCase - Whether to ignore case
      suffixes - The suffixes to test
      Returns:
      The first suffix found to be equal to the end of the string, or null if the string ended in none of the specified suffixes

      public static String rchop(Object subject, String... suffixes)

      Parameters:
      subject - The string to manipulate
      suffixes - The suffixes to chop off the right of the string
      Returns:
      A String that does not end with any of the specified suffixes

    • lpad

      public static String lpad(Object obj, int width)
      Left-pads a string to the specified width using the space character (' ').
      Parameters:
      obj - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is returned without padding.
      Returns:
      The left-padded string

    • lpad

      public static String lpad(Object obj, int width, char padChar)
      Left-pads a string to the specified width using the specified padding character.
      Parameters:
      obj - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is returned without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left-pad the string
      Returns:
      The left-padded string

    • lpad

      public static String lpad(Object subject, int width, char padChar, String delimiter)
      Left-pads a string to the specified width using the specified padding character and then appends the specified terminator.
      Parameters:
      subject - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is returned without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left-pad the string
      delimiter - A delimiter to append to the padded string. Specify null or an empty string to indicate that no delimiter should be appended.
      Returns:
      The left-padded string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If terminator is null

    • pad

      public static String pad(Object subject, int width)
      Centers (left- and right-pads) a string within the specified width using the space character.
      Parameters:
      subject - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
      Returns:
      The left- and right-padded string plus the terminator

    • pad

      public static String pad(Object subject, int width, char padChar)
      Centers (left- and right-pads) a string within the specified width using the specified padding character.
      Parameters:
      subject - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left- and right-pad the string.
      Returns:
      The left- and right-padded string plus the terminator

    • pad

      public static String pad(Object subject, int width, char padChar, String delimiter)
      Centers (left- and right-pads) a string within the specified width using the specified padding character and then appends the specified delimiter.
      Parameters:
      subject - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left- and right-pad the string.
      delimiter - A delimiter to append to the padded string. Specify null or an empty string to indicate that no delimiter should be appended.
      Returns:
      The left- and right-padded string plus the terminator

    • ltrim

      public static String ltrim(Object subject, String chars)
      Left-trims all characters contained in chars from the specified string. The resulting string will not start with any of the characters contained in chars.
      Parameters:
      subject - The String to trim
      chars - The character to trim off the String
      Returns:
      The left-trimmed String or the input string if it did not start with any of the specified characters

    • rtrim

      public static String rtrim(Object subject, String chars)
      Right-trims all characters contained in chars from the specified string. The resulting string will not end with any of the characters contained in chars.
      Parameters:
      subject - The String to trim
      chars - The character to trim off the String (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      The right-trimmed String or the input string if it did not end with any of the specified characters

    • trim

      public static String trim(Object subject, String chars)
      Left and right-trims the specified string. The resulting string will neither start nor end with any of the specified characters.
      Parameters:
      subject - The String to trim
      chars - The character to trim off the String (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      The trimmed String.

    • substr

      public static String substr(String str, int from)
      Substring method that facilitates substring retrieval relative to the end of a string.

      1. If the input string is empty and from equals zero, an empty string is returned.
      2. If from is negative, it is taken relative to the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      str - The String to extract a substring from
      from - The start index within string (may be negative)
      Returns:
      The substring

    • substr

      public static String substr(String str, int from, int length)
      Substring method that facilitates substring retrieval relative to the end of a string as well as substring retrieval in the opposite direction. The from and length arguments works as follows:

      1. If from is negative, it is taken relative to the end of the string.
      2. If length is negative, the substring is taken in the opposite direction, with the character at from now becoming the last character of the substring.
      Parameters:
      str - The String to extract a substring from. Must not be null.
      from - The start index within string (may be negative)
      length - The desired length of the substring
      Returns:
      The substring
      See Also:
      • CollectionMethods.sublist(List, int, int)

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
      Returns the index of the nth occurrence of the specified substring within subject. If subject is null, or if there is no nth occurrence of the specified substring, the return value will be -1. You can specify a negative occurrence to search backwards from the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for (must not be null or empty)
      occurrence - The occurrence number of the substring (1 means: get index of 1st occurrence)
      Returns:
      The index of the nth occurrence of the specified substring

    • substrBefore

      public static String substrBefore(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
      Returns everything up to (not including) the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string if there is no nth occurrence of the substring. If the type of subject is String, you can do a reference comparison between input and output string to ascertain whether the substring was found. Returns an empty string if subject is null. You can specify a negative occurrence to search backwards from the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      occurrence - The occurrence count of the substring
      Returns:
      Everything to (not including) the nth occurrence of the specified substring

    • substrTo

      public static String substrTo(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
      Returns everything up to, and including the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string if there is no nth occurrence of the substring. If the type of subject is String, you can do a reference comparison between input and output string to ascertain whether the substring was found. Returns an empty string if subject is null. You can specify a negative occurrence to search backwards from the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      occurrence - The occurrence count of the substring
      Returns:
      Everything up to, and including the nth occurrence of the specified substring

    • substrFrom

      public static String substrFrom(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
      Returns everything from (inclusive) the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string if there is no nth occurrence of the substring.If the type of subject is String, you can do a reference comparison between input and output string to ascertain whether the substring was found. Returns an empty string if subject is null. You can specify a negative occurrence to search backwards from the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      occurrence - The occurrence count of the substring
      Returns:
      Everything from (inclusive) the nth occurrence of the specified substring

    • substrAfter

      public static String substrAfter(Object subject, String substr, int occurrence)
      Returns everything after (not including) the nth occurrence of the specified substring, or the entire string there is no nth occurrence of the substring. If the type of subject is String, you can do a reference comparison between input and output string to ascertain whether the substring was found. Returns an empty string if subject is null. You can specify a negative occurrence to search backwards from the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to search
      substr - The substring to search for
      occurrence - The occurrence count of the substring
      Returns:
      Everything after (not including) the nth occurrence of the specified substring
